page.title: 10Housing
page.content: The majority of{houses}in{Dinnington are either private terraced{houses (some are NCB-owned).Most of the terraced{houses}were built in the 1900's,but the council{houses}between the two wars.Most people who own there own house use{coal}for fuel because there is a{coal mine}in{Dinnington that produces{coal}and many miners live in the village. People who live in shops on{Laughton Road}live upstairs or behind the shop in flats.Some people have to build extensions on there homes because there{house}is not big enough.About three quarters of the{houses}have gardens. The terraced{houses}have slate roofs and brick wall.The council {houses}have slate roofs and concrete rendered walls.
